title: Rapid Blaster Pro
content:
The Rapid Blaster Pro is a main weapon in the Splatoon series, manufactured by Deco.

The Rapid Blaster Pro is a Rapid Blaster with an elongated handle and barrel, and increased range to match. Its range is the greatest of all blasters. As a trade-off, it has a slightly slower fire rate and higher ink consumption compared to the Rapid Blaster. Damage output and blast size are identical for both weapons.

The Rapid Blaster Pro is similar in appearance to the Rapid Blaster. However, the nozzle is longer, and there is a gray bar connecting the red panels at the bottom to the handle.

The Rapid Blaster Pro was released on 17 October 2015 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It comes with Seekers and the Inkzooka. Each shot consumes 10% of the ink tank capacity, and the ink tank recovers 1.67% of its capacity between each shot, allowing the player to fire 11 shots before needing to refill on ink.

- The Rapid Blaster Pro is a middleweight weapon.

- Each shot consumes 10% of the ink tank capacity.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 40 frames (1.5 shots per second).

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.57 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 20 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 80.

- Shots travel straight for 11 frames.

- Shots have a radius of 2 units.

- Shots cannot ever deviate from the inner reticle while on the ground.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 5 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. The outer reticle will finish shrinking after 60 frames.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 40%.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 14 units per frame for 11 frames. Shots travel straight for 154 distance units.

- Ink droplets occur every 15 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 12 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 1 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Droplets that occur within 11 units of the player have a radius of 19.2 units.

- Droplets that occur when they travel past 200 units of the player have a radius of 18 units.

- All other ink droplets have a radius of 11.5 units.

- The shot explodes 15 frames after being fired.

- The far damage radius of the explosion is 35 units.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the far damage radius is 17.5 units.

- The near damage radius of the explosion is 5 units.

- Damage from the explosion scales from 25 at the far damage radius to 80 at the near damage radius.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the damage scales from 12.5 at the far damage radius to 40 at the near damage radius.

- When the shot explodes in the air, it creates a splash of paint with a radius of 28 units.

- The wall impact painting radius is 17 units.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

[2]

- ▲ Fire rate when firing from a squid state: 17 frames → 12 frames.

- ▲ Recovery time after firing: 26 frames → 20 frames.

- ▲ Special gauge loss: 50% → 40%.

- ▲ Movement speed while firing increased by about 15%.

- ▲ Spread when player is jumping reduced by about 50.%

The Rapid Blaster Pro is based on the Rapid Blaster, but it's further specialized for increased range. Follow your Seekers to zip into an advantageous position and strike from your opponent's blind spot! The Inkzooka makes this a great set for frontline fighters who like to cause big problems for their foes!(NA)

The Rapid Blaster Pro returns in Splatoon 2 looking identical to how it did in the first game. It was released on 23 September 2017 at 02:00 UTC[3]. It comes with the Toxic Mist and Ink Storm. Each shot consumes 8% of the ink tank capacity, allowing the player to fire 12 shots before needing to refill on ink.

It appears in seven Octo Expansion stations:

- B03 Spin Docto Station

- C08 Right Round Station

- F03 Pop Star Station

- F08 Jump Station

- G02 Hasta La Vista Station

- I01 G01 Toastmaster Station

- J02 Matchmaster Station

- The Rapid Blaster Pro is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 192. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption of 8% and ink tank capacity of 100% allows players to fire 12 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When firing from swim form, the first shot takes 21 frames to come out.

- The interval between firing and when the player is able to enter swim form or use a sub weapon is 20 frames.

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 40 frames (1.5 shots per second).

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.5 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 50 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 85.

- The bullet hitbox has a radius of 2 units.

- Shots cannot ever deviate from the inner reticle while on the ground.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 8 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. After 40 frames, the outer reticle will start shrinking, and will finish shrinking after 70 frames.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 50%.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 14 units per frame for 11 frames. Shots travel straight for 154 distance units.
After that, the shot's velocity is set to 13.426 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- Droplets have their radius multiplied by a value ranging from 1 if they fell from a height above 100 units to 1.2 if they fell from a height below 30 units.

- The shot explodes 15 frames after being fired.

- The far damage radius of the explosion is 33 units.
Main Power Up increases the far damage radius up to 35 units.

- Damage from the explosion is 35. Damage does not change based on distance from the center of the explosion.

- When the shot explodes in the air, it creates a splash of paint with a radius of 28 units.

- ▲ Direct damage: 80.0 → 85.0.

- ▲ Minimum indirect damage: 25.0 → Indirect damage is now locked at 35.0.

- ▼ Ink recovery delay: 20 frames → 50 frames.

The Rapid Blaster Pro owes its incredible range to a chamber system that delays ink oxidization to the last possible moment!
If you match this range with the Toxic Mist, your opponents will curse your very existence!
The Ink Storm provides cover for your teammates, so I'd recommend this set for players who enjoy the technical aspects of battle!

The Rapid Blaster Pro returns in Splatoon 3 with a new design. Its kit is the Toxic Mist and Ink Vac.

It appears in two missions in Return of the Mammalians:

- 0307 Rail Pass

- 0408 Easy Ride, Tricky Targets

- The Rapid Blaster Pro is a middleweight weapon.

- The ink consumption is 8% per shot, allowing the user to fire 12 shots on a full ink tank.

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 40 frames (1.5 shots per second).

The Rapid Blaster Pro owes its incredible range to a chamber system that delays ink oxidization to the last possible moment! With that technology in hand, try catching your enemies in a little Toxic Mist before giving them a few inksplosions as a parting gift. And if anyone gets too close? Fire up the Ink Vac, and turn their own inkpower against them! This is a set that will make the tactically inclined player veeery happy.

The difference between the three versions of the Rapid Blaster Pro: The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is the only one whose lights do not illuminate when fired. (link to file)

For competitive tips about the Rapid Blaster Pro

- This weapon resembles a toy dart blaster.

- Prior to version 3.0.0 of Splatoon 3, the colored parts on the 2D icons for the Rapid Blaster Pro and Rapid Blaster were colored yellow. This was corrected to the white color upon release of the update.

- The lights on the sides of the weapon illuminate when fired, but the second variant of the weapon, the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco, does not.
